to make someone or something more important or to improve something: They want to elevate the status of teachers. These factors helped to elevate the town to the position of one of the most beautiful in the country. be elevated to something formal
to be given a higher rank or social position: He has been elevated to deputy manager. She was elevated to the peerage (= was made a peer).
